articles.title: U.S. reaches deal with European Union over steel and aluminum tariffs - NPR
articles.description: Announced at the G-20 Summit in Rome, the deal is meant to protect American producers but tamp down on the cost increases that the original tariffs have led to.
articles.content:
Steel ingots emerge from an oven at the Saarsthal rail plant in Hayange, France, on Sept. 13, 2021. The United States and European Union have reached a deal on steel and aluminum tariffs.

articles.title: Coal countries balk at G20 phaseout calls - POLITICO Europe
articles.description: Australia, India, China and Russia hold out against a push to target coal.
articles.content: ROME A group of coal users and coal exporters is blocking efforts for the G20 to call for an end to coal use something organizers had hoped would send a powerful signal ahead of COP26 climate talks s… [+5632 chars]

articles.author: Michał Broniatowski, Andrzej Stankiewcz
articles.title: Donald Tusk says Warsaw ‘retreating’ on rule of law - POLITICO Europe
articles.description: Opposition leader vows that top government officials will be brought to justice if they lose next election.
articles.content: WARSAW EU institutions successfully forced Poland’s nationalist Law and Justice (PiS) party government to backtrack on some of the judicial reforms at the heart of a growing conflict between Brussels… [+5674 chars]
